intro: Canthium barbatum, commonly known as the hairy spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, as well as its small, clustered flowers.
